intro: Bromus mollis var. lepidus, commonly known as the hairy brome, is a perennial grass species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant produces spikelets that are loosely arranged along the stems, typically bearing two to three flowering bracts. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, pastures, and disturbed areas. Due to its adaptability, it is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain regions.
